parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74558

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.DSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: A categorization of the disposition events, which is used to distinguish between disposition events, protocol milestones, and other events.
fields.implementationNotes: This would most commonly be a heading on the CRF or screen, not a question to which the site would provide an answer. In this implementation scenario, DSCAT="PROTOCOL MILESTONE" or "OTHER EVENT".
fields.label: Category for Disposition Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: DSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the disposition?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.DSSCAT

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the DSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be pre-printed on the CRF or screen and pre-populated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. DSSCAT can only be used if there is an DSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of the Protocol Milestone or Other Event.
fields.label: Subcategory for Disposition Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: DSSCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the disposition?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99079

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.EPOCH

fields.completionInstructions: Check the [epoch, or insert more appropriate wording] for which disposition event is being recorded.
fields.definition: Trial Epoch (e.g., 'BLINDED TREATMENT', 'OPEN LABEL TREATMENT', 'SCREENING', 'RUN-IN') for which subject disposition is being collected.
fields.implementationNotes: If protocol milestones or other events are collected more than once in the study, EPOCH may be needed to differentiate them. Typically, the trial epoch will be pre-printed on the CRF as part of the title of the page; however, some companies have a standard CRF module that includes a pick-list of epochs. See the SDTMIG for further information regarding EPOCH.
fields.label: Epoch
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: EPOCH
fields.questionText: What is the trial period for this disposition event?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C114118
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C150811

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.DSDECOD

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: The standardized terminology of the disposition term.
fields.implementationNotes: Refer to the SDTMIG for guidelines for assigning DSCAT, DSTERM, and DSDECOD for events considered protocol milestones or other events. Where DSCAT = "PROTOCOL MILESTONE", DSTERM contains the verbatim (as collected) and/or standardized text; DSDECOD uses the extensible controlled terminology codelist (PROTMLST). Where DSCAT="OTHER EVENT", DSDECOD uses the extensible controlled terminology codelist (OTHEVENT).
fields.label: Standardized Disposition Term
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. Both DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM.
fields.name: DSDECOD

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.DSTERM

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

self.title: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor provides instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: The verbatim or pre-specified name of the disposition term.
fields.implementationNotes: When defining protocol milestones or other events, sponsors may populate DSTERM and DSDECOD with the same value (e.g., RANDOMIZATION, INFORMED CONSENT OBTAINED). DSTERM may also be populated with a verbatim term, which is then standardized in DSDECOD.
fields.label: Reported Term for the Disposition Event
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM must be populated in SDTM.
fields.name: DSTERM

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.DSSTDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the date of the protocol milestone/other event as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions, using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of the specified protocol milestone (e.g., informed consent, randomization) represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each protocol milestone/other event and its associated (start) date.
fields.label: Disposition Event Start Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DSSTDAT
fields.questionText: What was the [protocol milestone/other event name] (start) date?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.DSSTTIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the time (as complete as possible) as defined in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions.
fields.definition: The time of the specified protocol milestone (e.g., informed consent, randomization) or other event, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsors should define in the protocol and/or CRF completion instructions the criteria for completion of each protocol milestone/other event (start) time. Collecting the time of the event is only appropriate if it can be realistically determined and if there is a scientific reason for needing to know this level of detail.
fields.label: Disposition Event Start Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH START DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable DSSTDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: DSSTTIM
fields.questionText: What was the [protocol milestone/other event name] (start) time?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Protocol Milestone.DSUNBLND

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Reported Term for the Disposition Event

fields.completionInstructions: Record "Yes" if the subject's treatment assignment was unblinded/unmasked intentionally due to an adverse event, or unintentionally for other reasons (e.g., an administrative action) during the subject's blinded/masked treatment.
fields.definition: An indication of whether the subject's treatment information was revealed to any unauthorized site personnel during the trial.
fields.implementationNotes: If DSUNBLND is "Yes" and information was collected about the reason for the unblinding, populate DSCAT with "OTHER EVENT" and the SDTMIG variables DSTERM with the free text and DSDECOD with the standardized text (e.g., TREATMENT UNBLINDED). If DSUNBLND is "Yes", and the unblinding also resulted in the subject discontinuing the trial prematurely, be sure to capture the applicable discontinuation details. If the unblinding occurred due to an adverse event, DSTERM contains the text of the AE (if collected on the CRF) and in the AE domain the SDTMIG variable AEACNOTH ("Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?") may include the text "Treatment Unblinded". DSUNBLND may also be used to document intentional unblinding at a protocol-defined point in the trial.
fields.label: Unblinded
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTM variable. If the CDASH field DSUNBLIND="Y", then the SDTMIG variables DSDECOD and DSTERM="TREATMENT UNBLINDED" and DSCAT ="OTHER EVENT". If DSUNBLIND="N", then the CRF should be annotated to indicate that this value is NOT SUBMITTED.
fields.name: DSUNBLND
fields.questionText: Was (study) treatment unblinded by the site?
